<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sort the function infos by address range first, preserving input order</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a076f93c387f454f0db13d4bc7d4e7f9c">llvm::stable&#95;sort</a>(Funcs);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;FunctionInfo&gt; TopLevelFuncs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Add the first function info to the top level functions</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal">  TopLevelFuncs.emplace&#95;back(std::move(Funcs.front()));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now if the next function info has the same address range as the top level,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// then merge it into the top level function, otherwise add it to the top</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// level.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Idx = 1; Idx &lt; Funcs.size(); ++Idx) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo">FunctionInfo</a> &amp;TopFunc = TopLevelFuncs.back();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo">FunctionInfo</a> &amp;MatchFunc = Funcs&#91;Idx&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (TopFunc.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo/#a102aa70a223f40f43c99d916bc69a603">Range</a> == MatchFunc.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo/#a102aa70a223f40f43c99d916bc69a603">Range</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Both have the same range - add the 2nd func as a child of the 1st func</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!TopFunc.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo/#a03611a5afc9cc137c5d0550d9e0a06f1">MergedFunctions</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No match, add the function as a top-level function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="normal">      TopLevelFuncs.emplace&#95;back(std::move(MatchFunc));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Remove duplicates function infos that have both entries from debug info</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (DWARF or Breakpad) and entries from the SymbolTable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Also handle overlapping function. Usually there shouldn&#39;t be any, but they</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can and do happen in some rare cases.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (a)          (b)         (c)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     ^  ^       ^            ^</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     |X |Y      |X ^         |X</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     |  |       |  |Y        |  ^</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     |  |       |  v         v  |Y</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     v  v       v               v</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In (a) and (b), Y is ignored and X will be reported for the full range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In (c), both functions will be included in the result and lookups for an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// address in the intersection will return Y because of binary search.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that in case of (b), we cannot include Y in the result because then</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we wouldn&#39;t find any function for range (end of Y, end of X)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with binary search</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumBefore = Funcs.size();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Only sort and unique if this isn&#39;t a segment. If this is a segment we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// already finalized the main GsymCreator with all of the function infos</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and then the already sorted and uniqued function infos were added to this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// object.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!IsSegment) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (NumBefore &gt; 1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Sort function infos so we can emit sorted functions. Use stable sort to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a076f93c387f454f0db13d4bc7d4e7f9c">llvm::stable&#95;sort</a>(Funcs);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::vector&lt;FunctionInfo&gt; FinalizedFuncs;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Idx=1; Idx &lt; NumBefore; ++Idx) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo">FunctionInfo</a> &amp;Prev = FinalizedFuncs.back();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo">FunctionInfo</a> &amp;Curr = Funcs&#91;Idx&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Empty ranges won&#39;t intersect, but we still need to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Overlapping ranges or empty identical ranges.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ranges&#95;equal) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="normal">            </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Same address range. Check if one is from debug</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="normal">            </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// info and the other is from a symbol table. If</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="normal">                Out.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gsym/outputaggregator/#a051eee638f618d1ebe54f433350b7c1d">Report</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Prev.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo/#a102aa70a223f40f43c99d916bc69a603">Range</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/addressrange/#afe148fdaacb37330c6cfb734abbf610a">size</a>() == 0 &amp;&amp; Curr.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo/#a102aa70a223f40f43c99d916bc69a603">Range</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/addressrange/#accce80061bb85f65b4223c49d91216a0">contains</a>(Prev.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/gsym/functioninfo/#a102aa70a223f40f43c99d916bc69a603">Range</a>.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/addressrange/#a37ab39927de3ceda2cd6766243b516b9">start</a>())) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">            </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Symbols on macOS don&#39;t have address ranges, so if the range</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If our last function info entry doesn&#39;t have a size and if we have valid</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// text ranges, we should set the size of the last entry since any search for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a high address might match our last entry. By fixing up this size, we can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// help ensure we don&#39;t cause lookups to always return the last symbol that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// has no size when doing lookups.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Funcs.empty() &amp;&amp; Funcs.back().Range.size() == 0 &amp;&amp; ValidTextRanges) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#a34bd74317e3f04bfc4318c2d1a470877">Range</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal">              ValidTextRanges-&gt;getRangeThatContains(Funcs.back().Range.start())) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="normal">        Funcs.back().Range = &#123;Funcs.back().Range.start(), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#a34bd74317e3f04bfc4318c2d1a470877">Range</a>-&gt;end()&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal">    Out &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Pruned &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; NumBefore - Funcs.size() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot; functions, ended with &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
